ja_sentence: みなさん、ようこそ、どうぞおかけください。
title: Presentation at a client's office 1

speaker: Tracy
en_sentence: I'm Tracy with Company A.
ja_sentence: 私はA社のトレイシーです。
title: Presentation at a client's office 1

speaker: Tracy
en_sentence: This is my colleagues Jim.
ja_sentence: こちらは私の同僚のジムです。
title: Presentation at a client's office 1

speaker: Tracy
en_sentence: Today we're going to show you how your team can use product A to engage with prospective clients as well as your current customers.
ja_sentence: 本日は御社のチームが既存顧客と同じように見込み顧客と関わっていかれるために、製品Aをどのように使用していただいたら良いかについて話をさせていただきたいと思います。
title: Presentation at a client's office 1

speaker: Jim
en_sentence: Thanks Tracy.
ja_sentence: トレイシー、ありがとう。
title: Presentation at a client's office 1

speaker: Jim
en_sentence: If you're like most businesses, you track your information using a lot of different tools.
ja_sentence: ほとんどのビジネスにおいて、情報の追跡は様々な違ったツールでなされています。
title: Presentation at a client's office 1

speaker: Jim
en_sentence: Finding your way through email, spreadsheets and presentations, can take up a lot of valuable time.
ja_sentence: 電子メール、スプレッドシート、プレゼンテーションなどから情報を探し出すために、多くの貴重な時間を費やしています。

speaker: Jim
en_sentence: Product A is a centralized tool where you can track everything you need in one place to run your business.
ja_sentence: 製品Aは、ビジネスを運営するために必要なすべての事柄を1箇所で追跡することができる集中管理ツールです。
title: Presentation at a client's office 1

speaker: Ben
en_sentence: How much does it cost?
ja_sentence: それはいくらぐらいするんでしょうか？
title: Presentation at a client's office 1

en_sentence: Product A is fully customizable, so it depends on which setup you choose.
ja_sentence: 製品Aは全てがカスタマイズ可能な商品で、どのような設定を選ばれるかによって価格は変わってきます。

speaker: Jerry
en_sentence: Ben, please let them get through their presentation.
ja_sentence: ベン、プレゼンテーションが終わるまで待って差し上げて。

ja_sentence: トレイシーさん、ジムさん、すみません、続けてください。

en_sentence: Not at all Jerry.

speaker: Jim
en_sentence: We encourage questions through the entire presentation.
ja_sentence: プレゼンテーション中はいつ質問してくださって結構です。
title: Presentation at a client's office 1

speaker: Tracy
en_sentence: We certainly understand that price is a very important question.
ja_sentence: 価格が大変重要な問題であることは確かに理解しておりますので。
title: Presentation at a client's office 1

speaker: Tracy
en_sentence: I don't want to give you the wrong price, so we'll look at a few options later in the meeting.
ja_sentence: 間違った価格を申し上げるわけにはいきませんので、会議の後半でいくつかの選択肢を見ていきたいと思います。
title: Presentation at a client's office 1

speaker: Tracy
en_sentence: Jim, can you tell them about organizing accounts?
ja_sentence: ジム、アカウントの整理について話してもらえますか？

speaker: Jim
en_sentence: Absolutely Tracy.

title: Presentation at a client's office 1

speaker: Jim
en_sentence: Product A can organize your contacts, accounts, sales deals and documents.

speaker: Ben
en_sentence: Where does it keep everything?

speaker: Jim
en_sentence: So, all you need is a web browser or a mobile device to access everything.

en_sentence: I can see how a sales team and management could make use of that.

en_sentence: That way when they're travelling, they can still have access to all of the information back at the office.
ja_sentence: 社外にいる時でもオフィスにある全ての情報にアクセスしていただけます。
title: Presentation at a client's office 1

speaker: Jim
en_sentence: Tracy, tell them how you start a typical day.
ja_sentence: トレイシー、君の1日の典型的なスタートの仕方を教えてくれますか。

en_sentence: The first thing I do is login to Product A and check my home page.

speaker: Tracy
en_sentence: At the top of the page are my tabs which quickly help me find all of the information I need.
ja_sentence: ページの一番上には私のタブがあり、私が必要な全ての情報をすぐに見つけるのに役立ちます。

en_sentence: Then I write my status update.
ja_sentence: それから私はステータスを更新します。

en_sentence: What's that used for?
ja_sentence: それは何のためですか？

en_sentence: To let my colleagues know what I'm working on now, and collaborate with them.
ja_sentence: 同僚に現在自分が取り組んでいることを知らせ、協力し合うためです。

speaker: Tracy
en_sentence: “My dashboard” is where I track the business data that is most important to me.
ja_sentence: 「マイ・ダッシュボード」は、みなさまにとって最も重要なビジネスデータを追跡する場所です。

en_sentence: You can follow the business information that matters the most to you.
ja_sentence: みなさまのそれぞれの業務に1番関係するビジネス情報をフォローしていただくことが出来ます。
title: Presentation at a client's office 1

speaker: Tracy
en_sentence: What sort of business data do you use the most often?
ja_sentence: どのようなビジネスデータを1番頻繁に使用なさりますか？
title: Presentation at a client's office 1

speaker: Ben
en_sentence: As a business manager, I need to track my team's deals to see what stage they're in.
ja_sentence: ビジネスマネージャとして、私はチームの取引を把握して、みんながどの段階にいるのかを確認する必要があります。

en_sentence: Can product A do that?
ja_sentence: 製品Aにはそれができますか？

en_sentence: Absolutely, you can see all of your team's deals.

en_sentence: Wow, this is really useful!

speaker: Lisa
en_sentence: How are the office rent negotiations going?

en_sentence: The owner is demanding a 20 percent increase.

en_sentence: If he doesn't change his mind, we should probably look for a new office.
ja_sentence: もし彼の気が変わらないようなら、他の事務所を探さないといけないかもね。

en_sentence: That's not a bad idea.
ja_sentence: そのほうが良いかもね。

en_sentence: If we were to find a new place, we need to consider what is most important.

title: Looking for a new office

speaker: Tiffany
en_sentence: Yes, if we found a location further away from downtown, we could probably get a bigger office for less money.
ja_sentence: そうね、ダウンタウンから遠い場所なら多分安い金額でもっと大きい事務所が借りられるよね。

speaker: Tiffany
en_sentence: Since our company is growing, we could use the extra space.

en_sentence: That sounds good, but we can't be too far out.

speaker: Lisa
en_sentence: Employees won't want to drive that far each day to come to work.

speaker: Lisa
en_sentence: Also, some of them use public transportation, so we shouldn't be too far away from a bus stop.

speaker: Lisa
en_sentence: Will we need to pay any penalty for breaking the current lease?

en_sentence: Yes, we will need to pay one month's rent.

speaker: Tiffany
en_sentence: However, that is much less than paying an extra 20 percent every month for the rest of the year.
ja_sentence: だけど、20%上乗せされた額を毎月年末まで払うよりは全然安いよ。

en_sentence: We need to consider security as well.

speaker: Mr. Toyama
en_sentence: Hello Mr. Kato.
ja_sentence: 加藤さん、こんにちは。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Kato
en_sentence: Hi Mr. Toyama.
ja_sentence: こんにちは、遠山君。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Toyama
en_sentence: I hope I'm not bothering you by coming to your office without emailing you first.
ja_sentence: 先にEメールをしないで加藤さんのオフィスに来てしまったのでご迷惑でなければいいのですが。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Kato
en_sentence: It's not a problem at all.
ja_sentence: 全く問題ないよ。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Kato
en_sentence: Did you want to ask me something?
ja_sentence: 何か聞きたいことでも？
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Toyama
en_sentence: Yes, I haven't been feeling well this morning.
ja_sentence: はい、今日は少し体調が悪くて。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Toyama
en_sentence: I think I may be coming down with a cold.
ja_sentence: 風邪をひき始めているのかもしれないんです。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Kato
en_sentence: Oh no that's terrible.
ja_sentence: そんな、それは大変だ。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Kato
en_sentence: Did you start feeling ill this morning?
ja_sentence: 今朝から調子が悪いのかい？
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Toyama
en_sentence: Well, I woke up late last night and was coughing.
ja_sentence: 実は昨日の夜中に起きたら咳をしていたんですよ。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Toyama
en_sentence: I thought I could still come into work, but I started feeling much worse after arriving.
ja_sentence: 仕事には行けるとは思ったのですが着いてからだいぶ体調が悪化してきているんです。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Toyama
en_sentence: Would it be ok if I left work early?
ja_sentence: 仕事を早退しても良いですか？
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Kato
en_sentence: I understand it isn't easy to work while you are feeling ill.
ja_sentence: 体調が悪い時に仕事をするのは簡単なことではないよね。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Kato
en_sentence: Also, it would not be good if others in the office got sick.
ja_sentence: それに他の人たちが風邪をひいても困るし。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Toyama
en_sentence: Right, I really don't want to get everyone sick.
ja_sentence: そうなんですよね、私も皆さんに風邪をひいてほしくないです。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Kato
en_sentence: So it's ok to go home early today.
ja_sentence: 今日は早退してもいいよ。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Kato
en_sentence: Please get some rest and email me tomorrow to let me know how you are feeling.
ja_sentence: ゆっくり休んで明日体調はどうかメールしてね。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Toyama
en_sentence: Thank you, I'll email you tomorrow.
ja_sentence: ありがとうございます、明日メールします。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Kato
en_sentence: That sounds good.
ja_sentence: わかった。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Kato
en_sentence: Just take care of yourself for now.
ja_sentence: お大事に。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Toyama
en_sentence: Thank you, I hope I can get over this soon.
ja_sentence: ありがとうございます、すぐ治せるようにします。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Kato
en_sentence: Definitely, go take a rest.
ja_sentence: そうだね、ゆっくり休んで。
title: Asking for permission to leave early

speaker: Mr. Taylor
en_sentence: Hi Mr. Williams.
ja_sentence: ウィリアムズさん、こんにちは。
title: Taking time off for an ill family member

en_sentence: Hello Mr. Taylor.
ja_sentence: こんにちは、テイラーさん。
title: Taking time off for an ill family member

en_sentence: I brought you in to talk about your performance over the past two months.

en_sentence: Unfortunately, it seems like you've been underperforming compared to your coworkers.

en_sentence: Is everything OK with you?
ja_sentence: 何かありましたか？

en_sentence: Yes, everything is fine.
ja_sentence: いや、特に何もないです。

en_sentence: However, I have been distracted by some personal issues in my life.
ja_sentence: ただ、最近個人的な問題があって、集中できないんです。

en_sentence: Actually, my father is in the hospital with heart issues.
ja_sentence: 実は私の父が心臓に問題があり、入院しているのです。
title: Taking time off for an ill family member

speaker: Mr. Williams
en_sentence: This has made it difficult to focus on work lately.
ja_sentence: そのせいもあり、なかなか仕事に集中できません。

en_sentence: I'm sorry to hear that.

en_sentence: I hope your father is recovering.
ja_sentence: 良くなるのを願っています。
title: Taking time off for an ill family member

en_sentence: Thank you.
ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
title: Taking time off for an ill family member

en_sentence: It would be OK if you need to take some time off to be with your family.
ja_sentence: 家族と過ごすために休みを取りたいのであれば可能ですよ。
title: Taking time off for an ill family member

speaker: Mr. Taylor
en_sentence: I'm sympathetic to family concerns.
ja_sentence: 私は家族のことに関して同情しています。
title: Taking time off for an ill family member

speaker: Mr. Taylor
en_sentence: However, I need you to come back ready to work.
ja_sentence: しかし、戻ってくるときには仕事が出来るように準備していただきたいです。

en_sentence: We have have many important deadlines next month, and I will need you to be focused on work.
ja_sentence: 来月たくさんの締め切りがあって、集中して取り組んでいただきたいので。

en_sentence: Thank you for your understanding.
ja_sentence: ご理解いただきありがとうございます。
title: Taking time off for an ill family member

en_sentence: I think a week off from work would be helpful to clear my mind.
ja_sentence: 一週間仕事から休みを頂くことで心の整理が出来ると思います。
title: Taking time off for an ill family member

en_sentence: No problem.

en_sentence: I was going to suggest you to take one week off.
ja_sentence: 一週間休みを取るよう提案する所でした。

en_sentence: I understand.

en_sentence: Please spend the time with your family and don’t think about work.
